website_summaries.verdict: A long-lasting collar that saves cat owners from having to apply topical treatments each month, and is highly effective at preventing fleas and ticks.
pros: Works well and lasts incredibly long at repelling fleas, owners report
Reflector attachments are a nice plus
Most owners feel collar is much more convenient than topical treatments, especially for very furry cats like Persians
Can be used on kittens 10 weeks and older
cons: Some reports of allergic reactions to collar, or irritation
Doesn’t always work, owners report, or doesn’t last the entire 8 months as indicated

website_summaries.verdict: High-quality flea collar that costs more than others, but it gives great results.
pros: No odor, which is helpful for pets who like to sit on your lap
Includes a quick-release mechanism in case the cat snags the collar on something
Gives cats eight months of continuous protection
Uses reflective clips for nighttime visibility
cons: Far more expensive than other cat flea collars
Some cats are sensitive to the collar

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this collar to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I would do ZERO stars if that was an option. I had this collar on my cat for 4 days, it was loose enough to easily spin around and fit 2 fingers between the collar and her skin. This morning she was acting odd so I started checking her out and realized that the collar has totally irritated her skin and taken a significant amount of hair off! Her skin is raw bloody and irritated. We cut off the collar and I’m taking her to the vet tomorrow. I do not recommend this collar for anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Sadowski

customer_reviews.title: Tremors Can Be A Side Effect
customer_reviews.text: I put the collar on my adult male cat and after about 48 hours he starting exhibiting tremors in his head. His head and ears were twitching. Both of the main ingredients in Seresto (Imidacloprid and Flumethrin) list tremors as a possible side effect in addition to a number of other things. I removed the collar and within 12 hours the tremors stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: We put the collar on our indoor car after noticing ...
customer_reviews.text: We put the collar on our indoor car after noticing fleas. After reading the insert, we were expecting some hair loss and reaction. However, we started noticing significant hair loss and bleeding after several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - This collar is extremely toxic to some cats ...
customer_reviews.text: WARNING - This collar is extremely toxic to some cats. My cat stopped eating, and by the time I realized it was the collar's fault she had already started liver failure. We are force feeding her to get her back up to snuff. The packaging warns about dermatitis issues, but not at all about the potential for toxins to cause your cat to stop eating. Cats cannot go without eating for long periods of time. Watch your cat VERY CAREFULLY after applying this collar and remove it if you see any signs of odd behavior - lethargy, decreased appetite, etc. It may take her days to recover after removal, so watch CAREFULLY.
customer_reviews.author: Hjorrdis

customer_reviews.title: Left my cats & dog with bald spots & sores
customer_reviews.text: Left my 2 cats and dog with literally bald spots and what looked like burns that had formed scabs. I wouldn’t know how well it worked. Bc I had to take them off and I basically threw money down the toilet. What’s crazy is NOTHING works against these damn fleas. Especially where I live and it was a nightmare all last summer trying product after product and keeping my vet in business! The vet suggested these. But when he saw the reaction all 3 animals had gotten from it. He certainly hasn’t mentioned it again to me (I can’t speak for others. But for me, that’s what he said)
customer_reviews.author: Tirotarot

customer_reviews.title: I have a cat who developed painful flea dermatitis
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who developed painful flea dermatitis. She was allergic to Advantage II. It caused an open wound where it was applied. The Frontline products did not work. Although I was hesitant to pay $50 for one collar, I had no other option. She was literally losing her fur and scratching miserably. What can I say, within one week she stopped scratching and her fur started to grow back. Its been more than 8 months and she is still flea free. Her fur is full, soft and beautiful. No signs of scaling on her skin. This collar really works and it does not cause any irritation to the cat.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Like a Cloud Promising Rain in a Drought
customer_reviews.text: I can understand the high star rating but not from anyone who actually lives where there are ticks year round. We and our cat live in an area that only sees high 20's for lows in the winter and therefore have ticks year round. Our cat goes out once a day just to prove she is a cat for about one hour. Well, after having the collar on her for one full week and yesterday, January 14 with highs in the forty's she ends up with a tick attached to her face within 2 inches of the brand new collar. So this collar is just all hype and no real substance in the real world of woods, cats, and ticks.
customer_reviews.author: Rita E. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats; one is an all outdoor cat and the other is a indoor/outdoor cat. Both cats have no issues with the flea collar. It doesnt leave any dust on their coats, they have had no reactions and they both wear it comfortably. We tend to get a good bit of fleas in the area we reside in and this product works extremely well!! Both my cats have not had any fleas!! I recommend this to anyone with cats and I will definitely purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Doodlebug22

customer_reviews.title: Best product
customer_reviews.text: I have been battling fleas for quite a while, using top of the line spot on product, spraying the house, bombed the house. I finally bought these collars and bombed the house again. No fleas! 2 weeks in extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SchultzsMom1129Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: NO THANKS Seresto! Did nuke them, now does NOTHING!
customer_reviews.text: We have used Seresto for the past couple of years to great effect. I have recommended Seresto collars to everyone! When Spring came we bought new collars, premptively, and we still got fleas. Even worse we have more fleas now than 2 months ago! I even bought a new batch of collars, thinking something was wrong with those we bought in February. But we have even MORE fleas. Now I am going to have to treat the house and yard! (we do not have carpets or upholstered furniture to harbor fleas in, so nothing to blame there.) Our beds and closets will need stripped and washed even at this point! Thanks for the EPIC FAIL Seresto!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seizure like twitching, unnatural weight loss, and hair loss!
customer_reviews.text: My cat started having severe twitches, and swift weight loss when using this collar. She itched and lost a ring of hair under the collar. I took it off months in advance when she lost 1/4 her body weight in 3 months. Wearing this was the only thing we changed. I do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Open sores developed within a week
customer_reviews.text: Open sore developed on my cat's neck after a week of use. I thought it was coincidental, so I left the collar on. After another week, a sore opened near his mouth - Off the collar went. It might work for some cats, but not mine. Pros: - It was easy to put on. - It had three reflectors that you could attach. Cons: - Negative reaction for some cats (open sores, itching, etc.) - The safety mechanism doesn't seem to work. It's difficult to loosen the collar using my strength, so I'm not sure how a cat would get free. - Expensive. Neutral: - I didn't see any evidence of fleas, but I had it as a precautionary measure.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: ... at my Vet's office (understandable) I have not been happy with these last two because my cats were still ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these because the price was much lower than what I paid at my Vet's office (understandable) I have not been happy with these last two because my cats were still suffering from fleas after the first month. The one I purchased from my Vet lasted the 8 months the product claims. I wonder if the ones sold online at lower costs are too old to be effective?? Has anyone else had this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne B.

customer_reviews.title: My cat had a terrible allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: My cat had a terrible allergic reaction. Her entire neck became raw and she lost all her hair (that was in contact with the collar). Watch your kitty very closely after you put it on.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Louise

customer_reviews.title: Caused cat to have diarrhea and lose weight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Seresto collars for my dog and cat. Dog seems okay, but Kitty had diarrhea last fall when he was wearing it. He was also restless and confused, but I associated neither his behavior or his diarrhea with the collar, unfortunately. Winter came, and I stored both the dog and cat collars as I had only used them for a couple of months. Spring here, and so I put the collars back on both pets. Kitty would not eat and had diarrhea within a day of wearing the collar. I've removed the collar and will have to find something else for flea protection.
customer_reviews.author: Pattywolford

customer_reviews.title: Useless, does not work at all and hurts cats neck.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and kept it on my cats neck and I followed all instructions when putting it on and I made sure to put it on correctly, after a week I realized it did not work at all and there were still fleas on my cat, I thought it would take w bit of time so ai just brushed my cat and made sure thwt he was completely clean of all fleas and flea eggs so that the collar can work, after 2-3 weeks I realized the fleas were back. Do not buy, it’s a waste of money and useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I got the collars and put them on per directed ...
customer_reviews.text: I got the collars and put them on per directed, the next day all of the cats I put them on were in serious condition. Clear fluid running from their eyes nose and mouths. 2 of the cats have burns where the collars were around their necks. I have been taking all of the cats on a every other day basis to the vet trying to save everyone. The collars made it almost impossible for them to breath. I have 2 kitties that are still on the fence as to if they are going to pull through.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Mattison

customer_reviews.title: I doubted- BUT THESE COLLARS ARE MAGIC
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this a few days and already it has worked wonders. We started to notice our little fur babies getting sick. Took them to the vet and To our dismay we learned our cats had TERRIBLE fleas! We tried everything! Flea bombs, pest control, and even regular monthly baths. We ordered this last second as a desperate last attempt. HOLY MAGIC!! Two days later and our oldest cat is flea free!! We ordered one for the rest of our babies. If you need a FAST working and EFFECTIVE and SAFE flea treatment- spend the money! THIS ACTUALLY WORKS PEOPLE!!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia O.

customer_reviews.title: CAUSED AN ABRASION ON HER NECK :(
customer_reviews.text: too heavy and rubbed on her neck, i did not see it, and i didn't think i needed to take the collar off so i felt terrible when i did take it off and saw that it had been rubbing so much against her neck under her chin the hair was gone and there was an abrasion on her skin!!!!! thankfully it was all healed in 2 weeks, i was furious!! UNACCEPTABLE!!
customer_reviews.author: FeistyDevil

customer_reviews.title: Slight problem for one of my cats
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and although I have not had a problem at all with one of my cats I was not as lucky with the other. The second cat had a severe allergic reaction to it and after wearing it for only two weeks had a bloody raw neck and had to be taken to the vets for antibiotics and steroids....I love that fact that it works also on my dog but wanted to warn others to watch their pets closely to be sure they don't react to it.
customer_reviews.author: pjmc

customer_reviews.title: Great product for your fur babies
customer_reviews.text: Modern miracle. My sweet kitty was being eaten up by fleas. Her skin was covered in scabs from her scratching. I tried this collar as a last resort. It changed our lives. No more fleas! Gone! Poof! Her skin is smooth again. Her fur is soft and fluffy. I know she is happier. You can tell. I’ve read of some fur babies having bad reactions. Thankfully we have had none of that. I put the collar on my cats in February, the beginning of flea season and they protect for a year. Your experience may vary. For my cats, this product is a life changer. Worth ever penny.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Holland

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: We're trying to introduce our cat to the outdoors. She's harnessed and loves it. Waited a week after putting collar on to be sure it would be effective...first time out, found a tick later that evening. Probably won't buy again...especially since it's supposed to prevent and repel. I really hate the topical treatments and wished Seresto worked as well as it claims.
customer_reviews.author: VirgoMom

customer_reviews.title: Deadly but not just for fleas!!!! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This product is deadly! We put a collar on each of our cats. One cat died and the other became very lethargic until the collar was taken off. DO NOT USE! It might kill fleas but it could also kill your cat, there is a reason they say to use gloves when handling it! Picture shows chemical burns after just two days!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Otterbox fan

customer_reviews.title: It does get rid of the fleas
customer_reviews.text: Both my dog and my cat were infested with fleas for days. I tried everything and nothing seemed to work. Somebody told me at the dog park about Seresto and decided to get one for each of my pets. It takes a while to start working but my God when it does you won't see any fleas in your house any more. It is safe and easy to put on your pets. They got used to it very quick. I finally solved a huge problem. I do recommend it to other desperate pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: This collar is fake. My cat and house is infested with fleas!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Soresto collar on my cat for 8 years. This is the first collar I have bought that not only did not work, my cat is infested and now my house is too. I now find that there is a sore under the collar when I removed it. My vet said the collar is not working at all. It is not old!!! FAKE SORESTO ALERT!!!! Do not buy this collar from companies that are not regulated. They sell fake materials!!!! Never again! My poor cat! And now I have to treat my house as well. Thanks a bunch!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Flea Protection
customer_reviews.text: I swear by Serestro collars now. We had a horrible flea infestation about 5 years ago. We tried all the popular brands on our pets to get rid of them, as well as some unconventional methods, to no avail. We finally tried Serestro, and we are never going back to the other products. It was maybe a week and all the fleas were dead and gone. We've been using them since then, and they have been a reliable flea preventative for all of our pets. I recommend these to anyone who is having flea problems, or simply for someone who doesn't want to get flea problems. Absolutely great product.
customer_reviews.author: CrimsonSandBoa (Megan Hancock)

customer_reviews.title: We had a nightmare infestation, this was a miracle
customer_reviews.text: We had a nightmare infestation, so bad we had to hire an exterminator. Our entire house was covered and I couldn't sleep or relax for days and nights, I am highly allergic and so is our poor cat. Our neighbour suggested this collar, as her doggies had a bad infestation too, and she said it cleared it up completely. I am so grateful to this company and this collar for FINALLY giving me peace of mind. It cleared our poor girl's fleas up within 2 days (and believe me, they were EVERYWHERE, the poor thing would wake up suddenly and growl as she licked and itched her skin). It's all we buy for her now. THANK YOU SERESTO!
customer_reviews.author: Dearbhla Klue

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: In 2017, these collars worked wonderfully on all my cats (all 3 of them). In 2018 I really don' t know what formula was changed or something is missing during the production but all 9 collars I ordered didn't work on any cats! These are expensive collars! I was very disappointed so I'm very hesitant on re-purchasing them this year. I will probably not going to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Not even 2 months of flea treatment.
customer_reviews.text: So I was extremely skeptical of this collar when reading the reviews. The first month I wa spike kmg this collar is magic. I purchased it the very end of December. It's now the middle of February and the cats are infested with fleas again and he collars are no longer working. It's a lot of money to spend for not even 2 months of treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: My cat has shown allergic reaction to this!
customer_reviews.text: After 3-4 days of having this tick collar on my cat, his fur around the neck were gone and the several spots around the neck were inflamed. The inflammation did not go down for a couple of days then he looks super irritated for like 2 weeks. I cannot believe I had spent $50+ on this tick collar. I should've listened to other peoples' reviews... My money back please!
customer_reviews.author: BY

customer_reviews.title: our one cat has no issues with the collar but the other one had a bad reaction, he wasn't acting himself the one night
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats, our one cat has no issues with the collar but the other one had a bad reaction, he wasn't acting himself the one night, we thought maybe he had ear mites because he was shaking his head and ears were down, then I decided to check his collar, thank goodness I did, he had an open sore. We immediately took the collar off, his neck has since healed, the hair didn't grow back. He is back to his lovable self. If you know your animal has sensitive skin I wouldn't recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R Pratt

customer_reviews.title: These are garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 for my 8 indoor cats. 2 still work 3 months later but only for the front of those 3 cats, fleas stay alive on their hindquarters. 4 stopped all together within 2 months, and one didn’t work at all right out of the package. I know most people don’t buy this many at one time but this is a lesson in quality control. So even if this product worked for you once based on their quality control you will definitely wind up buying one that won’t. And these are expensive. Absolute total waste of money for me, buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: seatuck45

customer_reviews.title: Not Working at All
customer_reviews.text: Put this collar on my cat on July 14 and it is not working. Very disappointed as we have used Seresto on her for years with zero issues but we purchased from the vet. I purchased this collar via Amazon and It is the LAST time I will ever do so. Do yourself a favor and get it from your veterinarian.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed loyal customer; haven't prevented fleas
customer_reviews.text: It's so disappointing because we have used this collar on our cats (4 of them) for a few years now. I brought one to the vet and she was INFESTED with fleas, it was disgusting. Now we will have to buy additional topical solution
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: We first tried a Seresto flea collar for one of our kitty’s 6 months ago and it worked great. We purchased 3 more after seeing how well the first one worked, but not a single one deterred the flea’s this time. After visiting the vet I discovered that there were counterfeit Seresto collars being sold through the internet. Based on the performance of all three of the new collars I’m pretty sure counterfeit collars were sent to us via Amazon. I spent more than $170 believing I was purchasing a great product, which did absolutely nothing to help and the flea problem got worse before figuring out they were defective. Buyer beware..
customer_reviews.author: I'm an Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last...better to buy from a reputable veterinarian
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the collars I purchased from my vet, these lasted less than 6 months before the fleas were back. I made sure to purchase from Amazon itself, not a third party seller, so they wouldn't be some sketchy Chinese counterfeit (or so I thought). Maybe they were old, or maybe the price is lower because they are a less effective/cheap version. Whatever the reason, I'm extremely unhappy that the collars didn't last anyways near the full 8 months like the ones I purchased from my vet. I'm biting the bullet and forking over the higher priceor to my vet. Feels like money wasted, no matter how cheap they are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Run away from this. It is harmful.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be convenient not to have to put on flea medicine on my cats every month despite the high price for this collar. I regret purchasing it. My cat lost hair around the neck and developed open wounds. I took the collar off immediately and threw it away. Many years later the cat developed a calcification lump around the neck area. It could be the result from the collar that I put on him, or not. It is a shame product like this is allowed to be in the market.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia P.

customer_reviews.title: Neighborhood Left Behind Cats
customer_reviews.text: several neighbors moved out and left their cats behind. I took over feeding them (3) after i saw one eating from a trash can. They were covered in fleas. It took several months to gain their trust, but i managed to get this collar on two of them; and the fleas are gone and their skin is recovering. Previously, I had purchased the Seresto Brand for my two dogs and they had horrible reactions; the cats however, are tolerating these well. Will purchase again, as I have one more to corral -- but that one is feral and will take a while.
customer_reviews.author: Somewhere in PA

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a little over one month, not 8 as advertised. I had bought two. One cat reacted so badly her neck looked like it had chemical burns. I’ve since read that this happens more often than not. That collar was returned immediately. The second cat had had hers on for a little over a month & she’s covered in fleas & flea eggs again. This collar does not work for 8 months & now we’re back to square one fighting fleas.
customer_reviews.author: M. Berman

customer_reviews.title: Kills bugs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It kills fleas and whatnot but it takes a couple of months to take care of flea larve. I put these on a pair of local friendly ferral cats that were being literally being eatin alive. After 4 months or so the collar was getting ahead of the infestion. At that point we put on new fresh collars and that finished off the last of the pests. Now we have 2 fat healthy ferral cats hanging out in our backyard. Miss Kitty and Baby say "Thank You".
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Saw results almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Originally I put 5 stars.. Thought it worked quickly and well and had many suggestions on this product. However, after a few weeks of use I noticed my cats hair was starting to fall out. By a months use he wasn't eating, he slept all day and wouldn't move, and acted disoriented. I removed the collar after a vet visit and a prescription topical and within 48hrs he is back to his usual temperament and is eating normally. Pretty disappointed since this was a pretty expensive 8 month solution that had I not noticed the signs could have seriously hurt my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 week no burns, flea free!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to work, everything else hadn’t, I fought with the myself over the reviews and pictures I read here regarding the chemical burns and convinced myself to take a chance as the percentage of kitties that have had an adverse effect were minimal. I’ve checked my cats daily to be certain to catch any ulcerations quickly. So far my kitties are happy and healthy, they’ve been wearing the collars exactly one week. The fleas here in Florida were making us miserable, we’d just moved from Colorado and never experienced this before. Very pleased with the results, within 2 days they weren’t scratching at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I could have imagined!
customer_reviews.text: My cat had completely gone manic and made herself bald from her backside all the way to the top of her tail. I barely saw any fleas on her but obviously there was some sort of bad reaction she was having. Within 24 hours of wearing this product, there were no new blood spots on her balding areas firm obsessively scratching which used to be a daily occurance. I’m a month in and her hair has grown back and she is back to normal. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Caitilin Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It worked, but important to note.
customer_reviews.text: At first, it didn't work as I had expected but that was USER ERROR. Thanks to people who responded to my questions, realized that the collar was way too lose. When they say two fingers, they mean two fingers. It has to touch the skin to work. Once tightened it took about a day and the cat quit scratching and no "flea dirt" was found by the 2nd day. Cat is so much happier and does not mind the collar at all..in fact does not even know it's there. No wounds on the neck....but it's only been 5 days. I will keep watching.
customer_reviews.author: Judex

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit leaves chemical burns.
customer_reviews.text: I think we must have received a counterfeit seresto on this last order. We have used seresto collars for several years with no issues but this one left a chemical burn and has our kitty in pretty bad shape right now. I don’t know how to make sure that we received the right item going forward so we will for sure not order these on amazon again. Too dangerous. Highly suggest avoiding these potential counterfeit collars.
customer_reviews.author: E. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY- damaged my cat.
customer_reviews.text: NO! Do not use this product on your animal. I’m sorry for the picture but the raw and bloody mess in my Cats neck is the result of wearing this product for three weeks. If you look at the second two pictures you will see, what is in our opinion- a serious and deadly design flaw. The inside of this collar has hard plastic “notches”, intended to secure the collar. These notches rub against your animals neck resulting in painful, bloody, raw patches. We will now need to see the vet for antibiotic ointment to ensure it does not get infected. Not what we had intended when we spent a small fortune on this collar. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dellaripa

customer_reviews.title: this one doesn't work effectively
customer_reviews.text: I am normally satisfied with Seresto. However, this one stopped working 2 months after I bought it. My cat's vet said I should contact Seresto for a replacement. I would like a replacement. These collars are expensive and should work for 6 months as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!  Family raves about these.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my indoor cat in early February. Though he's not allowed out, I can't keep mice from getting in now and then. So there's the rare flea issue to deal with if he catches a mouse. My brother-in-law can't recommend these highly enough for fleas. He bought two for his indoor/outdoor cats during a flea infestation, and said the fleas were gone in two days. They had been driving his wife and grandson crazy until he got these collars. My main issue is ticks since I live in a year-round high risk area. I hope it lives up to its claim tick-wise since mice carry them also.
customer_reviews.author: Cr8vN8v

customer_reviews.title: Furrever flea-free ♥️
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these collars for my dogs and cats for about six years now and I gotta tell you-they are amazing!!! My pets used to get fleas so badly from playing outside and no amount of “ schmuntline” or baths ever fixed the issue. But as soon as I got these collars and put them on the fleas were completely gone within the first week and they’ve not gone a day without their Seresto since. They’ve never had any side effects to the collar either-they just work. Do your furry family members a favor and order these-they may seem a bit pricey but you honestly get what you pay for and these are so worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing/Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Our collar was delivered May 7th. Today is May 16th and I had to remove the collar at least 2 days ago because my poor cat already had a huge sore from the collar. As if that wasn’t bad enough we noticed a significant decrease in his appetite and he was losing weight. Thankfully he regained his appetite within 10-12 hours of removing the collar and he’s starting to fill out and behave like himself again.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Works great but does not last 8 months
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats, so monthly flea treatments are expensive and really don't work that well anyway. This product works great. It solved our flea problem almost immediately. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it does not last 8 months. I purchased this product in January. As I write this, it's June. Yesterday one of our kitties was at the vet, who noticed that she has a few fleas. So, I'm going to reorder, but we really should have been able to make it through the summer without purchasing new collars.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Reader

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, But they do work
customer_reviews.text: Have an older cat who got fleas BAD. Tried bathes, name brand collars, DE, Sticky Flea traps and just couldn't get rid of them... This did it. I was a little worried with some of the reports of issues but I had none. Bob is 12+ years old and isn't in the best of health, and he tolerated this collar fine. Still wearing it and not a flea to be found. Wish they were cheaper, but I'd buy them again because of how well and fast they worked.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: seems to work, cat does not mind it
customer_reviews.text: I could say my cat loves this... but I would be lying. She loves nothing but food and sleep, and destroying house plants. But, alas, I love it. Because I didn't have to wrestle the small beast and squirt anything onto her shoulders. Nor did I spend 30+ per month on a monthly treatment that stinks. I hesitated to buy this for a long time because the beast is allergic to fleas and this doesn't stop a bite, but rather will kill or repel the insect eventually. Overall, it was effective keeping populations from remaining on her even with a dog that goes in and outdoors and bringing in new offenders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked before but doesn’t now!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our dog and cat and have been happy for a year. Purchased new ones in March and they don’t work at all. We now have a miserable flea infestation and I’ve lost a good chunk of money. Not working on the cat or the dog. I’m so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Fires Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Breakaway DOES NOT work!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT REPLY ON THE "BREAKAWAY" PART OF THIS COLLAR! To hear your cat thrashing around and find her hanging by the collar choking is not what I expected after reading all of the product information! There's a section that is supposed to break with the "normal" strength of the cat if it were to get hung up. After cutting the collar off my husband couldn't even get that section to break. My other cat was unable to wear the collar bc of sores after 4-5 days. WILL NEVER BUY AGAIN OR RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffiny MarQuess

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 2 of 3 cats.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product on 3 of my cats. It burned/rubbed the neck of one of the cats - the same on that leaps away when you apply a topical flea preventative. It did not bother the other cats at all. Bayer promptly refunded the cost of the collar for the cat who had an adverse reaction and I was pleased that they were willing to do this. For the price, it is hard to beat this product as there aren't any others comparable that actually work. I think this is a fine product that works well for many animals, but it clearly shouldn't be used in animals that aren't checked on regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Best for my cat with long hair
customer_reviews.text: I have a fluffy cat with long hair (Coon). I have tried the liquid flea medication many times but I don't think its effective because of all the fluff. My cat also HATES when it is applied. This collar is easy to put on and my cat does not mind it at all. I have not seen any types of skin irritation. I noticed less scratching after a week of wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It's only been 3 months and winter! They have fleas!! The first collars last yr worked great for all 8 months (from the store). From Amazon, purchased the end of December and my cat and dogs have fleas already and it's only been in the 60's for the last week.
customer_reviews.author: Truther V

customer_reviews.title: Sickly little man
customer_reviews.text: First off.... I think it is a remarkable consept but unfortunately my little man had a bad reaction. Very lethargic and diarrhea. I got the all weights and he is 8 months and around 4 lbs. Maybe, thinking optimistic the dosage to weight is off by a little or he might just be over sensitive. I tried taking it off for 2 weeks untill he looked and acted better then put it back on to be sure and yes....it did start again. I am thinking of maybe letting him wear it one day a week or something. Besides this I think the idea is great. I just wish my outcome was different.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: BEST FLEA PRODUCT IN THE WORLD!!
customer_reviews.text: I was desperate to rid my pets and home of fleas. We have 6 cats and 2 of them go outside regularly. We had fleas everywhere, even in my bed and crawling in my hair!! I was going crazy. Revolution wasn't even working. I bought 1 Seresto collar to try, and it got rid of nearly all the fleas in our 2000 sf home! So I bought collars for the other cats. I haven't seen a single flea since! I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!! *Update: It's been 5 months and still no fleas!! Not a single one!! I will update at 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This is all we buy now!
customer_reviews.text: You will not find a better flea and tick remedy for your kitties. Do NOT waste your money on anything else. Even if your home is infested, this one collar will rid your entire home of fleas. Trust me, I speak from experience! We had tried the back of neck drops, house foggers..we even had the vet give my kitty a single dose pill, which I will never have any pet suffer through again. Days after we put the collar on the cat there were no more fleas to be seen. Within a week we saw no more bites on anyone in the family. This collar is so worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3 "in house" cats...these actually work! Have tried other brands without such remarkable results. *One word of caution...make certain that you trim any excess when applying the collar. I have a Munchkin cat with a small neck & she managed to tighten the collar by grabbing the excess! That was frightening...be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Not Right. Look at the pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Do not use. Something is way off about the material or chemicals in this product. What you are looking at is my miserable 1 1/2 y/o Seal Point Siamese cat hugging me because he is so upset and in pain over what this collar did to him. Thank God we caught it in time and were able to get him treated. He will be ok in time and every day it gets better. But please please listen to these reviews and look at the pictures and get direct from your vet. I cried all day holding my baby boy. Don’t trust it with your animal, it isn’t worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Suydam

customer_reviews.title: Keep a watch out for reactions
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats. 2 cats are doing fine with these collars but 2 had Very bad reactions. One kitty has open burn like sores on his neck and the side of his sweet face and 1 kitty started losing the fur around her neck where the collar was. Both of these issues happened so quick - just overnight!!! Off these collars came. I feel so bad I put my babies through this. I don’t blame Bayer. It’s just cats can be allergic or have bad reactions in different ways - just like people. Needless to say these 2 Kittys are never wearing these collars ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Kottage Vintiques

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THESE ONLINE.
customer_reviews.text: This collar has burned a hole in my cats neck. I've been using Seresto Flea and Tick Collars for years and have never had this problem. Additionally the one I bought for my shih tzu dog from Amazon made her extremely ill and she could not stand for 2 days. I will only buy these from a local store from now on. These might be cheap knockoffs and if they are they did a good job with the packaging. I am extremely upset.
customer_reviews.author: H. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Choked my cat
customer_reviews.text: The collar repelled ticks and fleas as far as I know but nearly killed my cat. I followed the instructions to put it on my cats. They wore it for about a month. Today my husband found our cat choking on her collar. It had become so tight that my husband struggled to cut it off to the point where she had passed out. Luckily he got it off and she’s okay. If there was a breakaway part so that this wouldn’t happen to others, the product might be worth it but I advise to anyone thinking of buying these collars for their cats to look elsewhere and try the kind of medicine that you apply between their shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: This will solve all your problems
customer_reviews.text: Used it last year during a flea infestation that was driving me crazy and totally killed all fleas along with cleaning floors once after purchased. Saved my life i had them bad and was going crazy seemed like the last 3 years they were worse than ever but still none this year without collar but I just bought another one just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Tore the fur off cats neck.  Thought it wwould grow back.... NOT.  POISON XXX
customer_reviews.text: These are not the same as sent to the USA. Other counties do not require the same standards. These DO NOT meet USA standards. DON"T BE FOOLED my cat is still alive. Coat NEVER grew back it is now Sept 2019. HUGE regret! If the seller was local I would have pursued them in a lawsuit.
customer_reviews.author: Tank 47

customer_reviews.title: Best Flea and Mosquito treatments for Cats
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for several years now. It might be expensive, but for the money, it is worth it. It does not burn the cats skin, it does not run their skin (Just do not put it on tightly), so long as your cats are used to collars on, this will not bug them. I have noticed a big reduction of them and fleas, as well as they do not get worms from the fleas anymore. I also love them because the Mosquitoes seem to stay out of my house too. LOL I will continue to get this product for my cats.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Adams

customer_reviews.title: easy, put in on and forget about it for the next six months!
customer_reviews.text: Use these on both my cat and dog, have for a couple years now, usually replace in 6-7 months... wish it would prevent mosquitoes! great item for the price, I find it better to replace every 6 months instead of every 8 months... might try putting a second one on my 95 lb dog just to see if it gives extra protection ...... treatment of an 18 lb dog with one collar seems sensible, treatment of a 95 lb dog with two (2) seems as though it might offer a little extra protection from resistant downtown fleas tbat all share a limited area ! much love to you all will update in a couple months john, RE, Brutus, Clive
customer_reviews.author: dink

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous product
customer_reviews.text: This does not break away if your cat gets stuck as described. We were woken up to our cat thrashing trying to break free from having this collar stuck. If we weren't home he could have died. We had to cut it off of him within 12 hours of putting it on. I followed the directions, but this product didn't work as advertised. Avoid!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only five months protection and the second collar had no effect.
customer_reviews.text: When I first used one of these collars on my cats (indoor only) I was delighted. Within two days they stopped scratching. But at the five month mark they started scratching again. I did not get eight months use from it. Then I put a second Seresto collar on them after the eight month period and there was no repeat of the first collar's success. It was as if the fleas had built up immunity to the collar. And these collars aren't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pequod

customer_reviews.title: Well pleased! After 24 hours, no more fleas.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my outdoor, long haired domestic cat. He's never had fleas before, but for some reason this year both my cats got them. I've never trusted or used "flea collars" - for a variety of reasons. But, I had to use something to get rid of these pesky fleas and natural methods weren't working. On a recommendation, and positive reviews, I bought Seresto. Within 24 hours, no more fleas! And though he's never worn a collar of any kind he doesn't seem to mind this one. I've noticed no side effects either. I'm well pleased and have purchased another for the other cat.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Easier for you and your cat
customer_reviews.text: Vet recommended! I buy these for both my cats. 8 months of protection is so nice. I dont have to worry about applying a greasy flea treatment every month. The cats like it better too! So much easier to replace a collar every 8 months than put a cold flea treatment on their neck every month. They even come with reflectors to put on the collar for outdoor kitties. I'm not sure that matters much for fluffy cats, but best to be safe. The collar isnt greasy to the touch which is nice. I would definitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Trebeca

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works
customer_reviews.text: I have bought multiple flea collars at lower prices but I would continue to still find fleas on my cat and see her scratch. Once I put this collar on, she started scratching less. After a few days, I found fewer fleas on her and after a week I found none. I was hesitant to purchase after seeing the price but it is worth it. The cheaper flea collars I’ve bought failed to work but this one has continued to work since I bought it. The scent of the collar isn’t strong I can’t even smell it when I cuddle with my cat. I haven’t seen any irritations from it either on her. She doesn’t seem to notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Maurissa Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: It actually works.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about this. I heard that the on line ones were fake. These were not. They were cheaper than the store price. I have not seen any fleas on my cats. I live in the country, and fleas were extremely bad this year. I have multiple cats, and I hated spending that much money, but it was worth it in the end. The other flea collars and squeeze behind the neck were just not working anymore. I actually spent more on them than if I had just bought these.
customer_reviews.author: Cathey McNabb

customer_reviews.title: NOT suited for our Animals
customer_reviews.text: Within a week our Cat was so ill, he appeared to be dying. When we took our Cat to the Vet, she had a fit that He was wearing this collar & asked that we take it off immediately. As we kept a close eye on Him after that, he began to recover from the overdose of chemicals that are a determent to the animal, as well as to the fleas. We had also purchased these for all of our additional animals & removed them & this was an expensive lesson to learn! Will not do that again, ever!
customer_reviews.author: MKW

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: SAVED MY SANITY. I tried diaphanous earth, Adam's plus spray, and some other spray that smelled like cloves. But every week I'd be frustrated as hell to be combing out fleas and finding more flea dirt laying around. This stuff was expensive but ultimately cheaper than the 3 other products I bought. Note: my flea problem wasn't *rampant* or anything. I have one cat, wood floors, and would comb about 5 fleas out of him on the daily. But I haven't seen any flea dirt since applying this collar. Best of all, it works for 8 months! Totally worth it. Do yourself a favor and make this investment.
customer_reviews.author: Felicity

customer_reviews.title: Too much conflictive information on these collars
customer_reviews.text: I did not care for this collar and actually returned it. I had it on my kitty and took him to get fixed , after picking him up the vet/vet tech had put the collar so tight on his neck I immediacy cut it off! They said it needed to be touching the skin, however in the instructions it states to have it where you can slide two finders underneath. Too much conflicting information on these.I now use Bravecto. I now don’t even let my cat wear a collar Unless I’m home because I has such a bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea81

customer_reviews.title: BEST buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had tons of issues with my cat bringing in fleas and ticks. After several trips to the doctor for tick removal (on me) and treating my home for fleas, I had enough! I decided to spend the money and try one of these collars. I am soooo pleased. It lasts as long as they say, it has no scent or residue and my cat does not even mind it being on. I was concerned because she goes outside, but it has the break-away feature, problem solved. As far as price, compared to what I was paying for a 3-4 week treatment from the Vet, this is a steal. This is the 2nd year and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These collars should be OUTLAWED!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these collars for my 2 cats. Both became lethargic and quit eating. One started throwing up and then had bloody diarrea 3 days after applying it! I had to take him to the ER, where the vet was "very familiar" with the poisoning of these disgusting collars. They should be outlawed! Pet owners BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work Great
customer_reviews.text: We switched from using the Frontline drops after they seemed to lose effectiveness and we as a result had a flea infestation. After two and a half years on the collars (changed at 8 month intervals) all four of our cats have remained flea free. One precaution. On one of our cats the collar became loose and got stuck in his mouth causing him to panic. As a result, he had a very swollen mouth and a lot of blood around his jaw. I now place the collars on and use a tie-wrap to prevent the collar from loosening.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: Not herself
customer_reviews.text: My cat wore this about 2 weeks and I noticed She started hiding and wasn’t eating or drinking and didn’t want to be near anyone Very unusual for her so I took the collar off and she’s back to normal after a few days She was wearing a regular collar before this So she’s use to them but the flea collar made her feel not herself So guess this was a waste of money and a bad idea
customer_reviews.author: ladybug21

customer_reviews.title: Fake
customer_reviews.text: Fake soresto collars, they look legitish. But they aren't. Don't waste your money. Order from chewy for the same price. Go look at videos on YouTube explaining the differences.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: Can cause serious skin irritation be careful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Collar specifically for a cat within a few days he developed a nasty rash around his neck and lost all his hair where the flea collar was touching him it was not too tight it fit perfect for some reason it just didn’t work for him. It’s a shame because these collars are expensive. If you see excessive scratching where the collar is be vigilant your animal could be having a serious skin reaction. When we removed the collar within a day or two he was fine. By the way he’s a huge ragdoll with tons of hair I’m surprised it bothered him
customer_reviews.author: MommypunkTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Maybe we have super fleas?
customer_reviews.text: Before we put this on, our cat was miserable. She couldn't even sleep because she was so itchy. She has been wearing this for about a month. Most of the fleas are gone but not completely so we use a flea comb daily and catch about 3-5 fleas everyday, especially when we go outside. It has brought a lot of relief for our cat and she hasn't had any allergic reaction to it. In fact, for a cat that hates collars, she is tolerating this very well. Perhaps we have super fleas because I am wondering why so many died but a few survived.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for all cat owners
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats is inside only and one comes in and out. After seeing fleas on both of them (while wearing a cheaper flea collar) I purchased a Seresto collar for each of them and have never had an issue since. I am currently on our second round of these collars. I have read the many reviews and don't agree that people should be rating this collar low because their cat has an allergy to it. While it is unfortunate and the photos are awful, it does not mean this is a bad product. It will well worth the money as I have tried cheaper versions in the past or the homeopathic versions and they simply don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D.

customer_reviews.title: Best flea collar on the market - well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: When I moved into my apartment, I brought my inside cat with me. He ended up with fleas shortly after moving in, and I tried several remedies. Nothing worked. Medicated drops, flea powder, sprays, baths...all of which did nothing. The fleas were soon out of control and biting me and my children. I bought this collar under suggestion of a friend, and it worked almost immediately. In the first two days, I started finding dead fleas wherever the cat had napped. I kept vacuuming them up, and eventually, they were totally gone. Totally. Our cat/home no longer has any fleas. I will be a loyal customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: Having 3 🐱s can be a little expensive when it comes to all of the preventive measures like flea collars. Thankfully, Serosto is a collar you have to change every 6 months. Plus, it's a break a way collar, so if your 🐱 were to get stuck the collar would break instead of them chocking. There's other collars on the market that are less expensive but you have to change them more frequently and in my opinion, not as effective. In this case, you get what you pay for. We've never had a problem with bugs and our 🐱s are never without these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Paigesperspective

customer_reviews.title: I think it works great!
customer_reviews.text: It didn't seem to be too effective at first... but after a couple of months of wear... I can tell it is helping. I think if the ticks weren’t so bad in my area... it would make all the difference... but having such a thick population... give any defense against ticks a run for its money. I like the product. Will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: kd16dd

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased so many products to free my poor cat from fleas and nothing until now has worked. I've bombed the house, sprayed the yard, applied topical monthly flea treatments, and many flea collars. I hesitated the purchase of this collar, however after reading many reviews decided to give it a shot. After 2 days, she was scratching less. After a week, she is my happy cat again. So happy I decided to give it a try! Absolutely the best flea product on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Condon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: These absolutely work. I would recommend buying off season so they're not as expensive. Can save around $10 if you do! But if you didn't, they're still a lot cheaper than trying to get rid of the fleas once they're in the house. Because of the concerns with kitties having bad reactions, I put mine on my kitties on a weekend since I wouldn't be going to work and checked my kitties constantly. My one kitty has sensitive skin and is allergic to flea bites. Had there been any redness or irritation on either kitty, I would have taken them off immediately. Luckily, neither of my kitties had a bad reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: only thing that seems to work
customer_reviews.text: my cat had a horrible case of fleas. she had chewed off most of her fur even. i was trying everything. collars, drops, pills, you name it i was trying it. nothing worked. friend told me about these. she has a lot more pets then me and doesn't have any problems with fleas at all. so i tried it. things seemed to work immediately. my cat is now on her second one and has all her fur back the cost might seem high. when divided by the number of months they are good for though they come out to be comparable to the cheaper flea collars. price wise at least. if i remember right they are good for eight months
customer_reviews.author: DeathOfTime

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend due to experience
customer_reviews.text: My cats collar got stuck between his mouth and neck. Very scary. I did everything the directions said about making sure the collar cannot get over the head of the cat.If I wasn’t home I don’t know what would have happened to my poor cat. Ripped these all off my cats after that. Will say deff got rid of fleas instantly for my animals , just wouldn’t recommend due to what I experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Dibble

customer_reviews.title: Magical!
customer_reviews.text: I am absolutely delighted with this product. I have three cats. They all had fleas for years. I tried many things from the Animal Clinic, but nothing seemed to work. I was looking online for a product and saw this recommended and decided to try it. Though expensive in outlay, for 8 months it is reasonable. I bought for all the cats. IT WORKED, in the first 24 hours. I could not believe. Its been a month and I continue to be very satisfied with the product, the cats are flealess, the indoor two, as well as the one who goes outdoors. I am sold. Excellent, and no ill effects on any of them. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: joyE

customer_reviews.title: Watch for allergic reactions, but collar is effective
customer_reviews.text: I have used seresto in the past for my cat while she was living with me and my aunt-who had a dog with fleas. This collar was effective in keeping my cat flea free, and I saw no adverse reactions. I'm sure allergic reactions are absolutely possible though, so definitely monitor your pet for any signs. Recently bought another collar for flea prevention now that I'm living elsewhere, so far so good. Thank you seresto
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Webster

customer_reviews.title: Gave Cat a Rash
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for ticks but gave my cat a terrible rash. Had to take it off, still haven’t seen any ticks so I’m unsure if that was even effective. This is his second one, the first one didn’t have this reaction- but it was very bad, ripped skin and hair. After a few months of wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: It's a crap shoot.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one of these before, and it seemed to work great. My kitty never seemed to have a flea or itch. But I had to replace it and it seems like one worked and 1 didn't ( I have 2 cats.) One cat didn't have fleas or itch anyway, while the other is RIDDLED With them still. It's been about 3 months so it has had ample time to work. SOOOO Angry as this was NOT Cheap. I bought 2 for my dogs and same thing - one seems ok the other is CRAZY itchy with fleas. Crap shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Works but not as efficient as claimed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because cat had flea infestation. Collar lessened fleas within 48 hours but two months later cat still has a few fleas even though collar claims to kill larva and new infestation. Could just be heavy flea year, but she still has a few every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: I had my cat on a seresto collar last year, and she was alright, this time with a replacement collar she developed a very bag wpund as a result of the collar and the vet said that when you buy a collar off Amazon that they are sometimes not actually a collar with the correct amount of chemical on it. Just buyer beware I thought amazon was a reputable source but actually I was wrong and had to spend a few hubdred dollars on out of pocket vet coats because the collar had too much chemical on it!
customer_reviews.author: Conor

product_meta.title: Seresto Flea and Tick Collar for Cats, 8-month Flea and Tick Collar for Cats
product_meta.description: The Seresto 8-month flea and tick collar for cats 10 weeks of age and older provides continuous 8-month flea and tick protection. Unlike oral flea and tick prevention products that require fleas and ticks to bite your pet to work, Seresto flea and tick collar for cats kills fleas and ticks through contact—no biting required. Seresto flea and tick prevention is also available for dogs. Seresto Flea and tick collars for cats contain two active ingredients: Imidacloprid to control flea infestations and flumethrin to repel and kill ticks. These active ingredients are slowly and continuously released in low concentrations, spreading from head to toes, even the tail, over your cat’s coat and skin. Seresto 8-month flea and tick collar for cats can be used alongside other identification collars. Avoid the hassle of messy monthly treatments and get the effective protection of Seresto flea and tick collars.
feature_bullets: Provides 8-months of continuous flea and tick prevention
Seresto flea and tick collar for cats works through contact, so fleas and ticks do not have to bite your cat to die
Vet-recommended flea and tick prevention for cats in a convenient, odorless non-greasy collar; No need for messy monthly treatments
Starts to repel and kill fleas within 24 hours of initial application
